column1: #Text=In this study, polycrystalline samples of (Cu1−xZnx)2OSeO3 (0 ≤ x ≤ 0.2) were prepared by solid-state reaction method.
#Text=Nominal mixtures of high purity CuO, ZnO and SeO2 powders were pressed into pellets.
#Text=The pellets were sealed in an evacuated quartz tube and heated to a temperature range of 520 °C to 600 °C for 72 h, then slowly cooled over several hours to room temperature.
#Text=This process was repeated at least twice with intermediate grinding.
#Text=X-ray diffraction patterns show good quality of samples, with only a minor impurity phases appearing when x ≥ 0.06.
#Text=Homogeneity of Zn distribution was analyzed with energy dispersive X-ray analysis, which indicated a uniform distribution of Zn throughout the sample (the supplementary material).
#Text=Temperature and field dependent DC magnetization and AC susceptibility measurements were performed by a SQUID magnetometer (MPMS-XL7, Quantum Design).

#Text=EXAFS K-edge experiments were carried out in transmission mode for Cu and fluorescence mode for Zn respectively at the 17C beamline in the National Synchrotron Radiation Research Center (NSRRC), Hsinchu, Taiwan.
